topics.body:
I just thought of something semi related to science and semi related to the internet; I think I know why there's so many people fighting about "morality" on the internet, cause certain groups know their days are numbered and they're afraid of their beliefs fading into the dark.

Look at all the constant fucking drama on the internet the last year all across the board.  What is it that every last one of them have all in common?  Everything from anti-vaxxers to extremist vegans to people opposed to new medications to fight diseases to social issues; what is the one thing they all have in common and I mean every last one of them?  The belief that science is persecuting them and that random internet blogger's personal opinions are truth.

Fifteen years ago it was "fact" that flushing a airplane toilet while sitting out of it would get you stuck.
Fifteen years ago it was "fact" that cellphones on airplanes would crash it.
Fifteen years ago it was "fact" that pop rocks and soda would kill someone.

These groups aren't winning; they're dying cause they can't survive being flashed with knowledge.  That's why they scream and kick and yell about "my feels!" because they can only exist when people are in the dark.  That's why these movements have to exist primarily on sites like tumblr or such cause the second they try to take control of mainstream society they burst into flames.

Tl:dr; tumblr and other sites are fucking terrible because that is the only place left where you can hide that much extremism in one place without people seeing it.
